title: Bounds on generics in trait definition are not propagated
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
use core::ops::Add;

pub trait RefOpsBound<'a, F, T: 'a>: Add<T, Output = T> {}
// Bound the type, and also the `S` type.
pub trait OpsBounds<'a, F, S: RefOpsBound<'a, F, Self>>: 'static + Sized + Add<Self, Output = Self> {}

pub trait WithVar: Sized {
    // This should imply Var: Add<Var, Output = Var> and &'a Var: Add<Var, Output = Var>
    type Var: for<'a> OpsBounds<'a, Self, &'a Self::Var> + Sized;
}

fn thing<F: WithVar>(a: &F::Var, b: F::Var) {
    a + b;
}
```

I expected this to compile, but instead it errors out:
```
error[[E0369]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/error-index.html#E0369): cannot add `<F as WithVar>::Var` to `&<F as WithVar>::Var`
  --> src/lib.rs:13:7
   |
13 |     a + b;
   |     - ^ - <F as WithVar>::Var
   |     |
   |     &<F as WithVar>::Var
   |
help: consider introducing a `where` clause, but there might be an alternative better way to express this requirement
   |
12 | fn thing<F: WithVar>(a: &F::Var, b: F::Var) where &<F as WithVar>::Var: Add<<F as WithVar>::Var> {
   |                                             ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0369`.
```
See this in action at this playground link: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=e17c4bf883f0692f6f02ac78a2560840

### Meta
This happens on the latest stable (1.66), as well as beta and nightly.
